fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • We mistakenly referred to the actor Patricia Arquette when we meant her sister, the actor Rosanna Arquette, in yesterday’s front page article about the Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein. Rosanna, not Patricia, has spoken about unwelcome sexual advances to her from Weinstein (11 October, page 1). • When, in an editorial about the Office for Budget Responsibility’s low productivity growth estimates for Britain, we said that before the financial crisis we would have expected “the economy” to double in size every 40 years, we meant to say “living standards” (Britain faces a bleak future without gains from growth, 11 October, page 28). • Our obituary of the picture editor John Morris misnamed his third wife Tana Hoban, as Tara (7 October, page 38). Other recently corrected articles include: ‘I’ve seen it all’: LGBTI elders come back out at the ball
